abstract.para: You can use &systemd; as a regular user for better security or when you do not have &rootuser; user privileges. Running an unprivileged service can be done by creating a user service.

topic.para: When creating and using a user service, consider the following points.

listitem.para: User service sessions are terminated when the user's session ends. This can be overridden by using the loginctl enable-linger USERNAME command.
User service files are located in /etc/systemd/user or $HOME/.config/systemd/user/.
You can control user services with the systemctl --user command.
